alice.goal: Help identify the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

bob.goal: Help identify the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available. Prefer to minimize interruptions to my morning schedule.

carol.goal: Help identify the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

orchestrator.goal: Combine availability reports from Alice, Bob, and Carol and produce a PDDL domain and problem that encodes finding the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 for the FastDownwards planner, preferring slots that minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues need to schedule a 30-minute meeting on 2025-10-21.
Participants are Alice, Bob, and Carol.
Goal is to find the earliest 30-minute time slot when all three are available.
If multiple slots are equally early, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

report_availability.system_prompt: You are Alice. Provide a concise structured availability report for 2025-10-21 using ISO style time ranges. Do not produce PDDL. State the available intervals and list any earliest 30-minute subslots you can offer within your availability.
report_availability.prompt: Your name is Alice. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private availability: {agents->alice->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->alice->goal}. Provide a structured availability report and possible 30-minute subslots derived from your availability.

report_availability.system_prompt: You are Bob. Provide a concise structured availability report for 2025-10-21 using ISO style time ranges. Do not produce PDDL. State the available intervals and indicate which 30-minute subslots are least disruptive to your morning commitments.
report_availability.prompt: Your name is Bob. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private availability: {agents->bob->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->bob->goal}. Provide a structured availability report and flag subslots by disruption level to your morning schedule.

report_availability.system_prompt: You are Carol. Provide a concise structured availability report for 2025-10-21 using ISO style time ranges. Do not produce PDDL. State the available intervals and list any earliest 30-minute subslots you can offer within your availability.
report_availability.prompt: Your name is Carol. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private availability: {agents->carol->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->carol->goal}. Provide a structured availability report and possible 30-minute subslots derived from your availability.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive structured availability reports from Alice, Bob, and Carol and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the scheduling task for the FastDownwards planner. Encode time as discrete 30-minute slots for 2025-10-21, include actions or constraints that ensure the meeting lasts 30 minutes and all three participants are free for that slot, and prefer solutions that minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Keep the agents' availability-derived actions distinct and identifiable by agent. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Target the FastDownwards solver.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Inputs: {workflow->orchestrator->pddl->input}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the availability reports and produce a PDDL domain and problem that find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot for 2025-10-21, preferring slots that minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Keep agent availability distinct in the model.
